intro: Clidemia barbata, commonly known as the hairy miconia, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine, hair-like structures. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Clidemia barbata is also known for its ability to form dense thickets, which can impact local ecosystems.
